# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Further Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 591, 94]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(x^{3} + 4x^{2} + 6x + 1 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 106, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 104, 400, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\alpha^{2} + \beta^{2} + \gamma^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 448, 186, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 448, 677, 467]]<|/det|>
Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 476, 740, 521]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\bigl ((\alpha +r)^{2} + (\beta +r)^{2} + (\gamma +r)^{2}\bigr) = n(n^{2} + an + b),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 527, 512, 546]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 527, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 84, 97, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 144, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
Use the method of differences to find \(\sum_{r = 1}^{n} \frac{1}{(kr + 1)(kr - k + 1)}\) in terms of \(n\) and \(k\) , where \(k\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 97, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 764, 109]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M} = \left( \begin{array}{ll} a & b^2 \\ c^2 & a \end{array} \right)\), where \(a, b, c\) are real constants and \(b \neq 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 129, 144, 148]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 129, 618, 149]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{M}\) does not represent a rotation about the origin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 129, 920, 148]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 316, 146, 335]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 316, 920, 352]]<|/det|>
Find the equations of the invariant lines, through the origin, of the transformation in the \(x - y\) plane represented by \(\mathbf{M}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 333, 920, 352]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 332, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathbf{M}\) represents the sequence of two transformations in the \(x - y\) plane given by an enlargement, centre the origin, scale factor 5 followed by a shear, \(x\)-axis fixed, with \((0, 1)\) mapped to \((5, 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 396, 144, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 223, 415]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathbf{M}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 396, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 737, 141, 755]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 737, 742, 755]]<|/det|>
The triangle \(DEF\) in the \(x - y\) plane is transformed by \(\mathbf{M}\) onto triangle \(PQR\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 766, 752, 785]]<|/det|>
Given that the area of triangle \(DEF\) is \(12 \mathrm{~cm}^2\), find the area of triangle \(PQR\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 766, 918, 785]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 584, 102]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r^2 = \frac{1}{\theta^2 + 1}\), for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 109, 144, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 109, 781, 131]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\) and state the polar coordinates of the point of \(C\) furthest from the pole.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 477, 178, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 477, 792, 500]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the region enclosed by \(C\), the initial line, and the half-line \(\theta = \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 479, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[455, 94, 616, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\left(\theta +\frac{1}{\theta}\right)\cot \theta -1 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 623, 152]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 1.1 and 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 678, 88]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 71, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 536, 144, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 528, 551, 560]]<|/det|>
Sketch the curve with equation \(y = \left|\frac{x^{2} - 2x - 15}{x - 2}\right|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 535, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 611, 102]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left| \frac{2x^2 + 4x - 30}{x - 2} \right| < 15.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 655, 92]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\varPi_{1}\) has equation \(r = - 4\mathbf{j} - 3\mathbf{k} + \lambda (\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}) + \mu (\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} - \mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 144, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 591, 123]]<|/det|>
Obtain an equation of \(\varPi_{1}\) in the form \(px + qy + rz = d\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 186, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 547, 523]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\varPi_{2}\) has equation \(\mathbf{r}.(- 5\mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{j} + 5\mathbf{k}) = 4.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 655, 555]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation of the line of intersection of \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) passes through the point \(A\) with position vector \(a\mathbf{i} + a\mathbf{j} + (a - 7)\mathbf{k}\) and is parallel to \((1 - b)\mathbf{i} + b\mathbf{j} + b\mathbf{k}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are positive constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 120, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 764, 139]]<|/det|>
Given that the perpendicular distance from \(A\) to \(\varPi_{1}\) is \(\sqrt{2}\) , find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 185, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 460, 767, 477]]<|/det|>
Given that the obtuse angle between \(l\) and \(\varPi_{1}\) is \(\frac{3}{4}\pi\), find the exact value of \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 460, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
## Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
